snippet: With violent dream sequences, dark symbolism and references to fascism, this 29-minute sound installation explores the repercussions of spatial-aural illusionism.
abstract: Karen Rosenberg reviews Janet Cardiff and George Bures Miller sound installation The Murder of Crows, part of the Mostly Mozart Festival, at the Park Avenue Armory.
lead_paragraph: With violent dream sequences, dark symbolism and references to fascism, this 29-minute sound installation explores the repercussions of spatial-aural illusionism.

headline.seo: ‘The Murder of Crows’ at Park Avenue Armory
headline.main: A Funereal Presence Swoops In to Roost and Caw
headline.print_headline: A Funereal Presence Swoops In to Roost and Caw
headline.kicker: Art Review | The Murder of Crows at Park Avenue Armory
